quotes.quote: It's not the events of our lives that shape us, but our beliefs as to what those events mean.
Laughter is the tonic, the relief, the surcease for pain.
For fast-acting relief try slowing down.
And thou wilt give thyself relief, if thou doest every act of thy life as if it were the last.
It's a relief to finally do it and get it over with.
Don't ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive, and go do it. Because what the world needs is people who have come alive.
To find relief in what has been, we must make ourselves eternal.
Relief loosens tongues beyond measure.
It's a good idea always to do something relaxing prior to making an important decision in your life.
When you taste super-success after tasting super-failure, there is huge relief.
One of the symptoms of an approaching nervous breakdown is the belief that one's work is terribly important.
Stress should be a powerful driving force, not an obstacle.
There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm.
Remember that stress doesn't come from what's going on in your life. It comes from your thoughts about what's going on in your life.
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
It is some relief to weep; grief is satisfied and carried off by tears.
Don't be pushed by your problems. Be led by your dreams.
Finding relief in your problem is fine, but it will not cure the problem.
For fast-acting relief, try slowing down.
Perhaps all pleasure is only relief.
Better a diamond with a flaw than a pebble without.
Give your stress wings and let it fly away.
There is a great relief in experiencing the worst vicariously.
If you want relief from pain just strive to touch more of every part of life.
The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
If there is to be no loss whatever of dignity or self-respect in getting and staying on relief, then there can be no gain in dignity or self-respect in makings some sacrifices to keep off.
Try a little harder to be a little better.
There's nothing like reading about a world that feels dead to throw your own beautiful, colorful life into sharp relief.
Don't give up when dark times come. The more storms you face in life, the stronger you'll be. Hold on. Your greater is coming.
The relief that is afforded to mere want, as want, tends to increase that want.
